snippet: The brothers — one a former New York City police officer, another a former Customs and Border Protection officer — worked with another brother to sell military-grade guns to customers in the Philippines.
abstract: Rex and Wilfredo Maralit plead guilty to weapons trafficking; prosecutors tell brothers that they will be eligible for reduced sentence guidelines if they persuade their younger brother Ariel, who is in the Philippines, to come to the United States and plead guilty; Rex Maralit is former New York City police officer and Wilfredo was once customs officer at Los Angeles International Airport.
lead_paragraph: The brothers — one a former New York City police officer, another a former Customs and Border Protection officer — worked with another brother to sell military-grade guns to customers in the Philippines.

headline.main: In Weapons Case, Prosecutors Press 2 Brothers to Urge 3rd to Come to U.S. to Plead Guilty
headline.print_headline: In Weapons Case, Prosecutors Press 2 Brothers to Urge 3rd to Come to U.S. to Plead Guilty
